get.description: Get a list of all available project customers. These are not resources, they are a separate datapoint altogether, used for keeping track of who a project is for.
This will give you a list of everyone who can be set as the manager of a project, generally this will be any resources with the Manager or Admin role.

parameters.name: resourceid
parameters.description: The resourceid of the resource you wish to retrieve assigned projects from.  Example 953f6497-4d34-4105-8d85-6b6c90bee238

post.description: Record the hours a resource has spent on a task on a specific date

date.description: Date of the timesheet to be created, must be in ISO format

hours.description: The decimal value of hours to log

projectId.description: The ID of the project you are logging time for

taskId.description: The ID of the task to log the time to, not required if you are instead using an `adminTypeId`

adminTypeId.description: Used to associate time with a non-task activity (such as meetings or leave), this field is required if you do not supply a `taskId`

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource you wish to log time for

name.description: This can be any text string, it's referred to as "Notes" in the product

parameters.name: taskid
parameters.description: The taskid of the task you wish to list the files of

get.description: Returns all the tasks in a project

Similar to Project Task List but child tasks are nested under their parents. This is useful if you want to see tasks in the way they appear on the gantt chart. Note that parent tasks are considered to be summaries of their children, you can not modify their values directly.

When creating or updating a task, you can specify a percent complete. Percent complete can be any number between 0 and 100, however in our software we often round the progress to 25 percent increments with friendly names such as "just started" for 25% and "half done" for 50%. This endpoint returns the named progress points and their values so that your app can show the same options to the user.
When creating or updating a task, you can specify a priority. This endpoint will give you a list of all the available task priority values.
⚠️Deprecated: Fetches details of a project board

post.description: Search for tasks in a project
